Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl

Class ALEdge

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.graph.ElementAdapter
fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl.ALEdge
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connected<Edge>, Edge, Element, Specialized, Identity, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ALDataEdge, ALReadOnlyDataEdge
public class ALEdge extends ElementAdapter implements Edge

The Edge implementation to use with ALGraph. AL stands for "Adjacency List". This class of edge records the Nodes at its two tips as startNode() and endNode(), so it is directed by default.

The constructor is hidden (protected): only ALGraphFactory can instantiate ALEdges. ALNode also provides methods to instantiate ALEdges as a by-product of connecting to another node (internally calling ALGraphFactory, of course).

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 10 mai 2019

    • traversal

      public Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance)
      Description copied from interface: Connected
      As traversal(), but stopping after distance recursion steps. For example, node.traversal(1) will return only node, while node.traversal(2) will return all the nodes connected with only 1 edge to this one.
      Specified by:
      traversal in interface Connected<Edge>
      Parameters:
      distance - the number of recursion steps to search
      Returns:
      the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance

      public final void replace​(Edge element)
      Description copied from interface: Connected

    • rename

      public void rename​(String oldId, String newId)
      Description copied from interface: Identity

      Renames an id to another one - CAUTION: this is for very limited use cases (i.e. when editing the graph) and should be avoided as far as possible because it breaks the id immutability paradigm. The default implementation throws an Exception.

      WARNING: This is a typical example of a hack we would like to remove. Although there is no problem conceptually in having mutable identities, as long as their scope guarantees their uniqueness it makes implementation very difficult. Uniqueness is much easier to guarantee if identities are immutable. So don't rely on this method, don't use it, you have never seen it, ignore it, forget it if you didn't ignore it in the first time. It will certainly be removed one day.

      Specified by:
      rename in interface Identity
      Parameters:
      oldId - The old Id string
      newId - The new Id string
